title.narrative: Denmark’s Contribution to the Sexual Rights Initiative (SRI) in 2020-2022, engagement

description.narrative: FL §06.36.06.24 Miscellaneous Multilateral Contributions

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Outcome 2. Diverse groups of SRHR advocates from developing countries have the knowledge, skills, and tools to effectively engage with the UN human rights system.

description.narrative: - 2 in-country trainings for SRHR advocates from developing countries on the effective use of international human rights mechanisms to hold their governments accountable for national SRHR obligations and commitments; - Development and promotion of SRI digital tools and resources to support national and local SRHR advocates, particularly in developing countries, in tracking their government’s progress on implementing human rights recommendations;

title.narrative: Outcome 2. Diverse groups of SRHR advocates from developing countries have the knowledge, skills, and tools to effectively engage with the UN human rights system.

description.narrative: - 2 in-country trainings for SRHR advocates from developing countries on the effective use of international human rights mechanisms to hold their governments accountable for national SRHR obligations and commitments; - Development and promotion of SRI digital tools and resources to support national and local SRHR advocates, particularly in developing countries, in tracking their government’s progress on implementing human rights recommendations;

title.narrative: Outcome 1. Linkages between SRHR advocacy at local, national, regional, and global levels are strengthened

description.narrative: - Collaborate with national and local civil society organizations and sexual rights advocates from developing countries to prepare eight UPR stakeholder submissions, treaty body shadow reports, and/or Special Procedure country visits per year focusing on sexual and reproductive rights issues; - Coordinated advocacy strategies to ensure national and local collaborators’ SRHR priorities are reflected in subsequent UPR, Treaty Body, and Special Procedure recommendations;

title.narrative: Outcome 1. Linkages between SRHR advocacy at local, national, regional, and global levels are strengthened

description.narrative: - Collaborate with national and local civil society organizations and sexual rights advocates from developing countries to prepare eight UPR stakeholder submissions, treaty body shadow reports, and/or Special Procedure country visits per year focusing on sexual and reproductive rights issues; - Coordinated advocacy strategies to ensure national and local collaborators’ SRHR priorities are reflected in subsequent UPR, Treaty Body, and Special Procedure recommendations;

title.narrative: Outcome 3. The UN human rights mechanisms make substantive advances in universal SRHR norms and standards

description.narrative: - Design and deliver three briefings/seminars per year for cross-regional groups of diplomats at the Human Rights Council to enhance dialogue on SRHR issues, to promote greater understanding of the SRHR challenges facing different countries and regions, and to provide technical expertise on defending and advancing SRHR within the context of the Human Rights Council, its related mechanisms, in order to promote domestic implementation of SRHR obligations and the advancement of universal human rights standards related to SRHR. -

title.narrative: Outcome 3. The UN human rights mechanisms make substantive advances in universal SRHR norms and standards

description.narrative: - Design and deliver three briefings/seminars per year for cross-regional groups of diplomats at the Human Rights Council to enhance dialogue on SRHR issues, to promote greater understanding of the SRHR challenges facing different countries and regions, and to provide technical expertise on defending and advancing SRHR within the context of the Human Rights Council, its related mechanisms, in order to promote domestic implementation of SRHR obligations and the advancement of universal human rights standards related to SRHR. -
